brief_summary.textblock:
Emergency departments are established in 20 hospitals in Denmark in order to improve the
      quality for the acute patients.

      A group of acute patients which require timely assessment and plan from a specialist is
      patients with abdominal pain.

      the aim of the present study is to evaluate whether the admission of the group of patients
      to emergency departments reduces the time to doctor, specialist and plan compared to the
      traditional admission to a surgical acute ward.

clinical_study.brief_title: the Patients Journey Through Surgical Admission Ward Versus Emergency Department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age more than 15 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

study_pop.textblock: all acute admissions to hospital due to abdominal pain

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Regional Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

primary_outcome.description: the time in minutes from the patient is admitted until the patient is seen by a doctor and until a treatment plan is recorded

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
